docs.abstract: A senior Marine is the subject of an inspector-general report for asking his aide to lend him money and run personal errands for him.
docs.snippet: A senior Marine is the subject of an inspector-general report for asking his aide to lend him money and run personal errands for him.
docs.lead_paragraph: A Marine general in charge of approving airstrikes against Islamic State fighters in Iraq violated ethics rules when he had a junior officer run personal errands for him and lend him cash, the Pentagon’s inspector general reported on July 5. The I.G. report found that Brig. Gen. Rick Uribe requested or allowed his aide, who was not named, to pick up his laundry, deliver meals and snacks, arrange for delivery of his prescription toothpaste to Iraq and handle his personal correspondence, among other tasks, while he was deputy commanding general of operations and director of joint anti-ISIS operations between May 2016 and June 2017. On multiple occasions, he also ordered her to stand next to and reserve gym equipment that he wanted to use, sometimes making her wait up to 40 minutes while he was called away.

headline.main: Marine General Used His Aide as A.T.M., Laundry Service and Gym Attendant

keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: With seductive aromas of almonds, vanilla and lilies, the fruit’s kernel adds a delight that is simultaneously familiar and indescribable.
docs.snippet: With seductive aromas of almonds, vanilla and lilies, the fruit’s kernel adds a delight that is simultaneously familiar and indescribable.
docs.lead_paragraph: Apricots are the most private fruit, loath to reveal their secrets. While other stone fruits grow tender on the surface as they ripen, apricots take an alternate path to maturity, softening from the inside out. I’ve given up on trying to tell whether they’re ripe by gently pressing on their skin, as I do with cherries, peaches and plums. I just rip one open at the seam, in search of juicy flesh that’s soft but not mealy.

headline.main: How to Unlock the Secret Flavor Hidden at the Apricot’s Core
